description: From Latin quiēscō ("I rest, repose, become quiet").

verbs.description: quiesce (third-person singular simple present quiesces, present participle quiescing, simple past and past participle quiesced)

entries.meaning: To make temporarily inactive or disabled.
(computing, transitive) To pause or reduce the activity of (a device or application), for example to prepare it for backups or other maintenance.
